#hd(0,7)ls grubhd(x,x)

grub rescue>insmod  /boot/grub/normal.mod

Post.title: codeigniter
Post.raw:
---
layout: post
title: codeigniter 
tags: codeigniter
date: 2011-12-17
categories: php
---
cookieurl_helper.php

```
<?php
/**
 * Get domain
 *
 * Return the domain name only based on the "base_url" item from your config file.
 *
 * @access    public
 * @return    string
 */    

function getDomain()
{
    $CI =& get_instance();
    return preg_replace("/^[\w]{2,6}:\/\/([\w\d\.\-]+).*$/","$1", $CI->config->slash_item('base_url'));
}
?>
```

Post._content:
##
###linux

+ l  
+ b  
+ c  
+ s  Socket
+ p  

ls -l,file filename

###
+  u g o
+  r(read)4 w(write)2 x(execute)1 s(set user/group id|sticky bit) 
	+ set user id 4755
	+ set group id  2755
	+ sticky bit  1777

###Login Shell
/etc/passwd::x:UID:GID:::login shell
eg:lightdm:x:104:111:Light Display Manager:/var/lib/lightdm:/bin/false

###
+ 
	1. /etc/profile
	2. .bash_profile
	3. .bash_login
	4. .profile
+ 
	1. .bash_logout
+ Shell
	1. (interactive) .bashrc
	2.  /bin/bash BASH_ENV /bin/sh

###
+ echo l{i,o}ve
+ cp file{,.bak} 
+ mkdir {1,2}/{3,4}

##Shell Script
###
+ `bash script.sh`
+ `sh script.sh`
+ `. script.sh`
+ `source .bashrc` 
+ . source script.shShell`echo $SHLVL` `ps axf`

###
+  `bash -v script.sh`
+  `bash -n script.sh`
+  `bash -x`

##
###
1.  `type bg`  bg is a shell builtin 
2.  `help -s`  eg: `help -s alias`  alias: alias [-p] [name[=value] ... ]
3.  `echo` -n  -e \n
4.  `cd -` 
5.  `:` 
6.  `alias ll='ls -l'` ,`alias ll='ll'`  `unalias ll` `unalias -a`
7.  `umask`   =-umask
8.  `set` Bash Shell `set -o vi`vi`set +o vi` vi,`set -o noclobber`/`set -C`
9.  `shopt` Bash Shell
10. `time`  `time ls -la`
11. read 
	+ `read input` input$REPLY
	+ `read -p "please input a word:"`
	+ `read -a arr<<(echo 1,2,3,6,5,4)` 
	+ `IFS=":";read f1 f2 f3 f4 < datafile` IFS
	+ `read -r raw` \
12. `exec` `eval` 
13. `man -k sort` 

###
$PATH

1.  `which top` PATHtop -a 
2.  `locate my.conf` my.conf
3.  date
    + `date MMDDhhmmYY` 
    + `date + "%d%h%m"` 
    + `date -R` RFC-2822
4.  ls
    + `ls -A`  `ls -a` .,..
    + `ls -F` (\*@=socket|,)
5.  `cat >file`<kbd>CTRL</kbd>+<kbd>D</kbd>file
6.  `head -n 4`4`head -c -20`20bytes,`tail`
7.  `wc` -c/w/l//
8.  `finde . -name "*.txt" -ctime 2 --exec rm -f {} \; ` 2text
9.  tar
	+ `tar -zxvf backup.tgz -C www/public` 
	+ tar tvf etc.tar 
	+ tar xzvf etc.tar 
	+ tar zcvf etc.tar 
	+ tar rvf etc.tar re.add.file 
	+ tar uvf etc.tar add.file 
	+ tar Avf 1.tar 2.tar all.tar 
	+ tar vf etc.tar --delete etc/hosts 
10. `basename /path/filename` filename
11. `dirname /path/filename` path 
12. `sort -nr +2 -t: /etc/passwd` -t  +2  -nr (ASCII)
13. `uniq file`-d-c 
14. cut
	+ `cut -c2-3 file` 2-3
	+ `cut -c9- file` 9
	+ `cut -c1` 1
	+ `cut -c-3,22- file`1-3,22
	+ `cut -d: -f3,1 /etc/passwd` paawd3,1
15. tr 
	+ `tr '[a-z]' '[A-Z]' < file` 
	+ `tr -d k` k
	+ `tr -s '[a-z]' '[a-z]' <file `aaaa
16. grep
	+ `grep -Rin "word" *`/`grep -Ril "word" *` word
	+ `grep -v "word" *` word eg:`ps -ef | grep nautilus| grep -v "grep nautilus"`
	+ `grep -q "word" file` 1/0$?
	+ `grep -A 2 -e 'someone (love|like) you' file` h2..
17. tee
	+ `tee -a file`=`cat >>file`<kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>D</kbd>
	+ `tee file`<kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>D</kbd>
18. `script log`,`exit`
19. top <kby>z</kby>
20. 
	+ sync&&shutdown -h now/+30/20:00
	+ init 0
		+ 0 
		+ 3 
		+ 5 
		+ 6 
	+ poweroff -f
21. chown root:root file
22. chmod 
	+ chmod u=rwx,g=rw file
	+ chmod a-x file

###
20. touch file  > file :>file
21. mkdir -m 777 file
22. mknod -m 666 file c/b/p n m // n m
23. mkfifo file   echo "h2ero" > file ,  cat < file
24. ln -sf file lnfile ln
25. stat file  
	+ stat -c "%a%n"  
	+ stat -f "%a"  
26. chattr +attr =attr -attr AaiD ///dump  
27. lsattr file 
28. gzip 
	* gzip -d 
	* gzip -c 
        * zcat


###
+ fc
	+ fc ssh ssh
	+ fc -s ssh ssh
+ 
	+ !!  = !-1
	+ !historyline historyline
	+ !-n n
	+ !ssh ssh
	+ !?home? home
	+ ^var1^var2^ var1var2
	+ !# ls !# ls ls
	+ !!:$ =$_
	+ !ls:1 ls=!ls:^
	+ !ls:* ls
	+ !!:3-5 3-5
	+ !!:s/var/var1/1var  var1
	+ !!:h 
	+ !!:t 
	+ !!:p 


###
1. cmd1&&cmd2 cmd1cmd2
2. cmd1||cmd2 cmd1cmd2
3. (cmd1,cmd2,cmd3)shell
4. { cmd1,cmd2,cmd3 }shell

##
###
+ ${A[index]}}arr=(1 2 3 4)
+ `${A[@]}/${A[*]}`
+ `${#A[@]}/${#A[*]}`
+  `arr[${#arr[*]}]=2`

###
+ unset -v variable unset -f function

###
+ export -p 
+ `declare -x LANG="en_US.UTF-8"`  `export LANG="en_US.UTF-8"`
###Bash 
+ $BASH bash
+ $BASH_VERSION bash
+ $CDPATH cd
+ $HISCONTROL ignorespace,ignoredups,ignoreboth
+ $HISTFILESIZE 
+ $HISTIGNORE `export HISTIGNORE=ls:ps:cd:t*:\& `
+ HISTTIMEFORMAT='%F%T' 
+ `locale` 
+ $PATH 
+ RANDOM
+ $*  "arg1 arg2 arg3"
+ $n n
+ $@  "arg1" "arg2" "arg3"
+ $# 
+ $? 1/0 
+ $$ bash shell  eg: kill $$
+ $_ 
	+ scriptbash/bin/bash
	+ 
	+ ,

###
+ readonly
	+ readonly -p 
	+ readonly -a/f 
+ declare 
	+ declare -p | grep x  x
	+ declare -p x x
	+ declare -a/f/i/r/x ////
	+ declare -F 

###HEREDOC
1. msg
		cat  <<HEREDOC >msg 
		doc
		HEREDOC
2. 
		cat <<HEREDOC 
		$USER can be used
		HEREDOC
3. 
		cat <<"HEREDOC"
		$USER can't be used
		HEREDOC

##
###
1. ${var} 
	+ 
            
	                 |                    |        |                          
       --------------------|------------------------|----------------|---------------------------------------
	   ${-}  |        |          |                                    
	   ${:-} |  |    |                                    
	   ${:=} |              |    |                                    
	   ${:?} |        |    | :  
	   ${:i} |            |  |                              

	   

	   | : |      |                    | 
	   |---|--------|--------------------------| 
	   | - |    |                  | 
	   | = |    |  | 
	   | ? |  |  | 
	   | - |    |                  | 


	+ 

	   | ${var:start}     |        | 
	   |------------------|--------------------------|
	   | ${var:start:len} | len        | 
	   | ${#var}          |              | 
	   | ${#var[@]}       |              | 
	   | ${#var[\*]}      |              | 
	   | ${var:start:len} | len        | 
	   | ${@:start}       |  | 
	   | ${@:start:count} |  | 

	+ 

	   | ${var#tpl}  |  | 
	   |-------------|--------------------|
	   | ${var##tpl} |  | 
	   | ${var%tpl}  |  | 
	   | ${var%%tpl} |  | 

	+  /str

       | 1 | ${var/tpl/str}  | tpl  |
       |---|-----------------|--------------------|
       | 2 | ${var//tpl/str} | tpl|
       | 3 | ${var#tpl/str}  | 1    |
       | 4 | ${var#tpl/str}  | 2    |

	+ 
		1. ${!var@}  `${!var*}` var
		2. ${!arr[@]}  `${!arr[*]}` 
2. $(cmd)  `cmd` 
3. 
	1. $((exp)) 
	2. `expr exp`
	3. $[exp]

##
1. if cmd1&&cmd2 if
	1. if-then
			if condition;then
				cmd
			fi
	2. if-then-else
			if condition;then
				cmd
			else
				cmd
			fi
	3. if-then-elif-then-else
			if condition;then
				cmd
			elif condition;then
			else
				cmd
			fi
2. 
	1. eg: grep -q ^h2ero$ filename
	2. [[ ]] eg: [[ str > xyz ]]
	3. test eg: test "str"\>"xyz"
	4. [ ] eg:[ "str"\>"xyz" ] , [ -f dir/file ]
3. case shopt -s extglob 
		case testitem in
			j|k|l) cmd;;
		esac
4. for
		for i in arr
		do
			cmd
		done
		for ((i=1;i<10;i++))
		do
			cmd
		done
5. while or until
		while condition
		do 
			cmd
		done
		
		while ((1))|true|:
		for(;1;)
		do
			cmd
		done
6. select 
		select s in arr
		do 
			$REPLY $f
		done
		eg:
		select i in $(ls ../)
		do
			if [ $REPLY=='q' ];then
				kill -INT $$
			fi
		done
##
###(file descriptor)
+ stdin 0 stdout 1 stderr 2

###
+ fileDescriptor<>file 
+ fileDescriptor<&- 
+ fileDescriptor>&- 
+ n<&m mn,nm
+ n>&m mn,nm
+ `>|` noclobber
+ eg:exec 6 < file ;cat <&6

##
+ `kill -l/trap -l`
+ kill 
	+ `kill -id/ PID`  `kill -s  PID`
	+ `kill -HUP PID` daemon
	+ <kbd>CTRL</kbd>+<kbd>C</kbd> INT
+ trap
	+ `trap "echo 'kill this ?'" INT`  INT
	+ `trap - INT`  INT
	+ `trap '' INT` INT
	+ `trap -p` 

##
+ |USER|PID|%CUP|%MEN|VSZ|RSS|TTY|STAT|START|TIME|COMMAND|
+ NI(nice) NI
	+ `nice -n num runapp`
	+ `renice num -p PID -g GROUP -u USER` //NI

###
+ <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Z</kbd>bg
+ jobs -l ,%%  %+%- %nnfg %n,%n&bg %n

##
+ 
		
		adduser h2ero
		useradd -D /etc/default/useradd
		deluser/userdle username ~ 

##
1. 
		
		cat /usr/share/i18n/SUPPORTED
		vim /var/lib/locales/supported.d/local
		dpkg-reconfigure --force locales
2. 
		
		export LANG=en_US
		xdg-user-dirs-gtk-update
		export LANG=zh_CN

    2. ${!arr[@]}  `${!arr[*]}`
  1. $(cmd) cmd
    1. $((exp))
    2. expr exp
    3. $[exp]

##

  1. if cmd1&&cmd2 if
    1. if-then
       if condition;then
     cmd
 fi
    2. if-then-else
       if condition;then
     cmd
 else
     cmd
 fi
    3. if-then-elif-then-else
       if condition;then
     cmd
 elif condition;then
 else
     cmd
 fi
    1. eg: grep -q ^h2ero$ filename
    2. [[ ]] eg: [[ str > xyz ]]
    3. test eg: test str>xyz
    4. eg:[ str>xyz ] , [ -f dir/file ]
  3. case shopt -s extglob 
     case testitem in
     j|k|l) cmd;;
 esac
  4. for
     for i in arr
 do
     cmd
 done
 for ((i=1;i<10;i++))
 do
     cmd
 done
  5. while or until
     while condition
 do 
     cmd
 done
 
 while ((1))|true|:
 for(;1;)
 do
     cmd
 done
  6. select 
     select s in arr
 do 
     $REPLY $f
 done
 eg:
 select i in $(ls ../)
 do
     if [ $REPLY=='q' ];then
         kill -INT $$
     fi
 done

  • n>&m mn,nm

  • kill -l/trap -l
  • kill
    • kill -id/ PID kill -s PID
    • kill -HUP PID daemon
    • CTRL+C INT
  • trap
    • trap "echo 'kill this ?'" INT INT
    • trap - INT INT
    • trap '' INT INT
    • trap -p

  • |USER|PID|%CUP|%MEN|VSZ|RSS|TTY|STAT|START|TIME|COMMAND|
  • NI(nice) NI

Post.title: Git
Post._content:
###Git ignore
1. .gitignore
```
git rm -r --cached .
git add .
git commit -m ".gitignore work"
```

###Git log
git log --oneline git log --pretty=oneline commit id 

###Git 
```
git log --shortstat --author "Aviv Ben-Yosef" --since "2 weeks ago" --until "1 week ago" 
    | grep "files changed" 
    | awk '{files+=$1; inserted+=$4; deleted+=$6} END 
           {print "files changed", files, "lines inserted:", inserted, "lines deleted:", deleted}'
```
###Git tip
1. reset --hard HEAD^git reflog idgit cherry-pickID
2. `git filter-branch -f --env-filter "GIT_AUTHOR_NAME='Newname'; GIT_AUTHOR_EMAIL='newemail'; GIT_COMMITTER_NAME='Newname'; GIT_COMMITTER_EMAIL='newemail';" HEAD`

[git contribution][0]
[git get contributor][1]

[0]:http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4592866/git-how-to-estimate-a-contribution-of-a-person-to-my-project-in-terms-of-added   "contribution"

[1]:http://codeimpossible.com/2011/12/16/Stupid-Git-Trick-getting-contributor-stats/   "git get contributor"
